Name: Italia 1917-1918: A Farewell to Arms
Description:
Italia 1918 - A Farewell to Arms is an operational wargame which simulates the fierce fighting which pitted the troops of the Entente (Italy, France, Great-Britain and USA) against those of the Central Powers (Austria-Hungary and Germany) during the period between the Battle of Caporetto (Oct 1917) and the Villa Giusti Armistice (Nov 1918).

Two A1 maps, printed front and back, are included. The “global” one covers the terrain between the Adige River and Trieste, to allow the players to simulate the whole campaign from Caporetto onwards. The “zoom” map, with enlarged hexes, covers the terrain from Adige to the Adriatic sea in order to concentrate on the main combat zone after the Italian retreat: the Piave River, the Monte Grappa Massif, the Asiago Plateau and the Trento area & for the second one the zone of the Austro-German offensive on the Isonzo that has been immortalised under the name of the battle of Caporetto. The 2 ½ countersheets include a complete OB for all the belligerents, from tenacious Italian “Alpini” to the redoutable German “Alpenkorps”, along with Austrian “Kaiserjäger”, Hungarian “Honvéd” divisions or French “Chasseurs des Alpes”.

Basic rules allow the players to tackle 6 variously sized scenarios, from 1 to 6 hours of play, using either a part of the board, or the map in its entirety. 5 of the scenarios are designed to be played on the ‘zoom’ map, in order to take maximum advantage of the improved play experience provided by the larger hexes. Advanced rules allow the players to simulate the whole campaign; they introduce the reconstruction of destroyed units, the management of strategic reserves and the use of random events cards (50 for each side) with various effects and evocative titles such as “Rommel”, “Hemingway” or “I ragazzi del 99” (“The boys of 99”), for example. Optional rules will allow players to explore several “what-if” possibilities.
 The campaign game is played on the “global” map, beginning with the Caporetto offensive and lasts 23 to 36 turns. 
 • Boxed game
• 2 A1 double-sided maps
• 1 A1 single-sided map
• 700 counters
• Rules booklet in english
• 24 pages campaign rules booklet in english
• 1 set of 100 event cards
• 2 A3 double-sided player aids [ Allied screen, Central powers screen ]
• 3 A4 single-sided player aids [ Strategic reserves for both sides & other tracks ]
• 4 A4 double-sided player aids [ Scenario setups ]
• 2 A4 single-sided player aids [ Reinforcements & Terrains ]
• 4 dice

(from Nuts Publishing website)

Name: Kickin' Your Caterpillar
Description:
This a set collection / take that card game for players of all ages where each player tries to get enough pieces to build their caterpillar all the while, using other cards to prevent their opponents from finishing their caterpillars.

The goal is to build your caterpillar by collecting and playing A Head piece, a Tail piece and four body pieces before the other players.

Components
This game deck is made up of 7 Head cards, 28 Body cards, 7 Tail cards, 20 Red attack cards, and 6 Green defense cards.

To complete your caterpillar you need to have in play in front of you, one Head, four Body segments, and one Tail segment. If you have those six cards in play in front of you, you win.

Other players will try to force you to discard pieces, or even take pieces from you for their own caterpillar.

Name: Kickin' Your Ass!
Description:
Kickin’ Your Ass is a set collection / take that card game where you try to build your Ass, while kicking other players’ Asses.
You try to collect each piece of Ass you can get your hands on. Once you have enough Ass to complete your Ass, you win. But along the way, other players are trying to kick your Ass. This of course results in you losing your Ass, or at least some of it.

Each player starts with a hand of four cards.  All cards are drawn from a common deck.  You build your Ass out of 5 cards, Tail, Back Legs, Middle, Front Legs, Head.
All the while, you play cards to Kick someone’s Ass which makes them lose pieces of their Ass. You can try to stop this by playing Get Off My Ass cards.

If you can find your ass with both hands, you can play Kickin' Your Ass!

(from publisher)

Name: Lethal Party
Description:
Drink shots, or get shot? That's a good question!

Welcome to the life-betting party! A bunch of desperadoes have gathered together — not to bet money, but to engage in a more primitive way to reach to the top: a drinking game. In this party, you can either be wasted or get shot. Only the fastest person can leave here alive.

Lethal Party is a speed game for 3-10 players in which you try to be quick and sharp to grab the correct card to fire your bullets at your opponents. Whoever can survive to the end is the sole winner.

Name: Mochiju
Description:
Show your power as only the mighty can strike! Bring your favorite space monsters along, and fight for the universe!

Mochiju is a quick card game for 3-6 players. Evolving your monsters down the right path or striking your opponents at the right time is the key to victory! Come enjoy the fun of beating your friends!

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Grombrindal and the Black Gobbo – Star Player Duo
Description:
Two new star players, Grombrindal, the white dwarf and his arch-nemesis, the Black Gobbo, are taking the pitch in Blood Bowl. Stats and rules for these two new star players are in the May 2017 issue of White Dwarf magazine as well as in a downloadable PDF.

Grombrindal’s reputation is almost mythological. Tales abound of his shrewd tactical advice on the field of battle; on the Blood Bowl pitch this translates to a mastery of team strategies and the ability to draw the very best out of the players around him.

The Black Gobbo is legendarily devious, as evidenced by his countless elaborate schemes to undermine the White Dwarf. Before he even thinks about setting foot on the pitch, it’s a given that he will have already established a web of bribery, hostage taking and other sneakiness that ensures the cooperation of the match officials.

Legendary heroes, this Star Player duo can be used in games of Blood Bowl as long as one player has a Dwarf, Halfling, Human or Norse team and the other has a Chaos Renegade, Goblin, Orc or Underworld Denizen team. They’re not hired in the same way as other Star Players – things like contract negotiations, legal issues or basic civility are pretty alien to them, honestly – and both must appear in your game.

Grombrindal is looking in fine form: his miniature features a splendid shock of white hair and a magnificent beard covering a purposeful scowl, with plenty of Dwarven iconography appearing on his kit. The Black Gobbo is appropriately robed and behatted, with sneakily studded armour beneath the robes – and a bomb. He’s clutching a bomb. That probably isn’t going to end well.

These resin miniatures come as 8 components, and are supplied with 2 32mm Blood Bowl bases.

Name: Sailor Moon Crystal: Truth or Bluff
Description:
Are you telling the truth or bluffing? Keep your opponents guessing as you pass tiles around the table and try not to get caught being too obvious. Watch out for the Dark Kingdom villains, though, because they can mess with your plans. When one player triggers the end of the game they are defeated and the player with the most number of Success Tokens is the winner!

A hilarious party game of deception and misdirection featuring super-deformed caricatures of your favourite Sailor Moon Crystal guardians!

Game Play Details
Players each attempt to avoid running out of Character Tiles and/or filling the conditions on the selected Ending Tile that triggers the end of the game while simultaneously trying to gain the greatest number of Success Token points. The player that triggers the game’s end has been defeated while the player with the greatest number of Success Token points is the winner.

Name: Zootopia: Mafia in the City
Description:
The king of the underworld Mr. Big and his gang are intimidating civilians, forcing them to flee the city. The time has come to rein in the carousing bandits.

The game is based on the classic, Mafia. Good citizens with the help of police are trying to expose the criminals and the bandits. Good citizens should find the bandits. Bandits' goal is survive till the end while citizens fighting against each other.

The mechanics of Mafia have been simplified for children, keeping the deduction part but removing the "killing" of other players.  Child friendly cards identify which team the player is on and what special powers/hidden roles they have.  As with traditional Mafia, the goal of the game is to find all the Bandits, before the good players are all exiled from the game.

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Percival Promo
Description: A hunt event card and a secret fighting art card that were included with the Percival miniature, which itself is not part of the game. The event card is meant to be shuffled into the standard hunt event cards to give a random chance to trigger the event "Dead Warrior". In this event it is possible to achieve the secret fighting art "Black Guard Style".

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – White Speaker Promo
Description:
Two gear cards and a sticker to alter the white speaker event in the rulebook. These were included with the White Speaker miniature, which is not part of the game.

Gear:

Speaker Cult Knife (Weapon, 3/6+/4, two affinities red upside, downside; deadly, sharp; while insane and not wearing armour or accessories, gain +2 evasion, +2 strength)

Bloodskin (Item, two affinities green upside, downside; When you depart you fill the bloodskin and gain two bleeding tokens. At the start of each your acts, remove 1 bleeding token)

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Fade Promo
Description:
This White Box Promotional Expansion for Kingdom Death: Monster expands on the hunt phase.  It includes a miniature to represent Fade, a Basic Hunt Event Card and two gear cards which can be gained during this hunt.  When this card is encountered, the survivors discover Fade's ultimate fate and can choose to brave the dangerous Harvester in order to gain the Sword of Silence, a Newborn child or possibly both.

This expansion has been said to include some interaction(s) with the upcoming Red Witches expansion.

Gear Cards:

Newborn 
Carried Item
No Affinities
Traits: Irreplaceable (If the survivor carrying this item dies, it is archived)
Passive Abilities: while you have this, all of your weapons gain slow. When you return to the settlement, archive this and gain +1 population.

Sword of silence 
Weapon, Sword
2 Speed/5+ Accuracy/6 Strength
Affinities: Top; Red Half, Left; Blue Half, Right; Green Half
Traits:
Sentient (You must be insane to wield this weapon)
Irreplaceable (If the survivor carrying this item dies, it is archived)
Unique (There may be only one copy of this item in your settlement at a time)

Passive Abilities: Gains sharp if you have 5+ understanding. While your settlement has this sword, ignore events "White secret" and "White Speaker")

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Before The Wall Promo
Description:
This White Box Promotional Expansion includes a miniature that represents Aya the Survivor wearing Vagabond Armor while wielding a Black Sword (Gormery) and a Beacon Shield (Blacksmith), this can be used to represent a female survivor in game.  Also included are two gear cards and an armor set card for complete Vagabond Armor (which is an alternate Leather Armor set).

Crafting Recipes for the gear cards are printed on the back. There is currently no way to craft the White Dragon Gauntlets, but it is speculated that this will change when the Ivory Dragon expansion is released.

In order to complete the Vagabond Armor set you will also need a copy of the 'Beyond the Wall' promotional cards.

Armor Set card: Vagabond Armor
Pieces required to complete the set
Tabard
Leather Chest or Leather Breastplate
White Dragon Gauntlets or Leather Gloves
Leather Skirt
Cloth Leggings or Leather Boots

You cannot wear head armor, but head accessories are allowed.

Full set bonus: 1 Armor to all locations, gain all the benefits of Sword Specialization and Sword Mastery.

Gear Cards:

Tabard
Torso Accessory (1 Armor, body)
Affinities: Left; Blue Half
Passive Ability: When you are encouraged, gain +1 insanity, if your settlement is barbaric or gain +1 survival if your settlement is romantic

Note: The Tabard requires the Cloth Starting Gear card to craft.

White Dragon Gauntlets
Hand Armor (12 Armor points)
Affinities: Red; Left Half

Passive Ability: Requires 3 Red Affinity: When you Sideswipe, gain +1 accuracy and +5 strength for your next attack this turn

It is not known what a Sideswipe in the game is at this stage.

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Twilight Thong
Description:
A gear card that was included with the Pinup Order Knight miniature, which is not part of the game.

Twilight Thong (Waist; 0 Armor; It's fabric responds to you: stress causes intense constriction. Do not suffer brain traumas (ignore this if you have destroyed genitals)

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Allison The Twilight Knight (White Box) Promo Cards
Description:
Two gear cards and a sticker that were included with the Allison The Twilight Knight miniature (which is not part of the game). The sticker alters the Twilight Sword Event in the rulebook.

The Gear Items are:

Blue lantern - Carried item, No affinities

     Traits: Sentient (User must be insane to use), Cursed (Once equipped by a survivor it cannot be removed from their grid and is lost when that survivor dies)
     Activated Ability: Suffer 2d10 brain damage and reveal Hit Location cards until you reveal the trap. Put these cards back in the same order. Limit once per showdown.


 
Dormant Twilight Cloak - Worn Head Accessory (3 Armor points), Blue Half-Affinity on top slot

     Traits: Unique (Only one copy of this card in a settlement), Irreplaceable (Lost if the survivor wearing it dies), Accessory (Can be worn in addition to other head slot items)
     Passive Abilities: Ignore sentient on all gear. You cannot depart with this if you have 3+ understanding

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Prismatic Lantern
Description:
A gear card that was included with the Pinup Warrior of the Sun miniature (which is not part of the game):

Prismatic Lantern (Item, no affinities; +1 Movement, Irreplaceable, Unique; During the showdown you may archive this and gain 1 permanent affinity of any color.

Name: Hot Seat: Even More Expansion
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Been through the original game a few times over? Know every question by heart? Freshen up the Hot Seat with all new questions that will keep everyone at game night on their toes.

These cards are similar in nature to the cards included in the original game.
Hot Seat is required to play this expansion.

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Nightmare Breast Pump
Description:
Gear card included with the Pinup Wet Nurse miniature, which is not part of the game:

Nightmare breast pump (Item, one blue affinity upside; Sentient, irreplaceable, female-only; The pumps lips mimic a baby's cries, stimulating milk glads. As a returning survivor, gain +1 to your intimacy rolls this settlement phase)

Name: Operation Pincher: Stalin's Drive In the Middle East, 1949
Description:
Operation Pincher (OP) is an alternative history wargame, designed by Ty Bomba, which allows two players to investigate the strategic parameters that would’ve been in place in southeastern Europe and the Middle East had Stalin attacked there at that time, most likely in conjunction with a drive into Western Europe. His goal in starting such an operation would’ve been to blitz to the oilfields and Allied base areas in North Africa and the upper Persian Gulf. That would’ve effectively broken the geostrategic back of the British Commonwealth of Nations, disrupted Europe’s oil supply, and delayed the US from being able to mount an atomic bombardment campaign into the USSR.

The scenario is based on the actual “Pincher” series of defensive plans drawn up in the Pentagon from 1946 through 1949.

There are rules for US atomic bombs, but their use is constrained by politics. That is, the late 1940s marked the arrival of the anti-imperialist (“third world” or “nonaligned”) movement on the world stage. So, if the Americans try to win by using enough bombs to blow to bits Stalin’s attacking horde, they do so much damage to the environmental and socio-political ecologies as to undo that victory in the strategic sense.

The extra-large-hex 34x32” map covers from Albania and Thrace south to Benghazi and Kuwait and east to Tehran and the Caspian Sea. Each hexagon represents 60 miles (97 km). Each of the eight full game turns represent two weeks of ‘real time.'

Communist units of maneuver are Soviet and satellite-nation armies (plus super-elite Guards Airborne divisions) along with Allied armies, corps, divisions, brigades, and regiments. There are no US units on-scene at the start of play, but army “regimental combat teams” and Marine Corps regiments and a brigade rush in as reinforcements. Air power is abstracted, with counters and rules showing the effects of one side or the other gaining temporary air superiority over portions of the map.

Since this is a secondary theater (in regard to a presumed main front in Western Europe), the Communist player is never certain exactly what his order of battle will be until set up. He knows, however, it will contain a total of 12 to 14 Soviet combined arms, mechanized, shock and tank armies, along with 10 satellite-nation corps and armies (and possibly three to seven divisions of ultra-elite airborne divisions).

Each match generally runs through three phases. In the first, the Communist juggernaut drives deep across Turkey and into Mesopotamia. Only the Turkish and Israeli Armies, and the use of a-bombs by the US, can slow the advance. As Soviet losses mount and US prestige sinks, the middle stage begins. It’s characterized by both sides maneuvering, seeking to hold or take still-contestable key areas. The Soviet guards airborne force is most likely to make its appearance. A-bombs are still going off, but their targeting has to be ever more selective and there are fewer such attacks. During this period a well executed Soviet campaign will achieve its victory objectives. The end game sees an Allied counteroffensive, as that player throws in everything he’s got to try to take back from the Communists enough victory hexes to overturn what will otherwise be their end-of-play win on points.

Name: Hot Seat: NSFW Expansion
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Ready to turn up the heat on the Hot Seat? These cards will have you sweating when it's your turn and laughing when it's someone else's. We've held nothing back and neither should you.

Ever wonder what your friends will only do when their drunk? Or what their most disturbing sex dream was about? There’s only one way to find out!
Hot Seat is required to play this expansion.

Name: Sum2Zero
Description:
SUM2ZERO is the innovative card game that puts a spin on zero-sum game theory.

Easy to Play
Each player starts with 10 cards.  The object of the game is to place 1 to 3 cards, so that your cards plus the base card add to zero. The first player with no cards wins the game.

Red cards are negative numbers from -1 to -12 while black cards are positive numbers from +1 to +12. Action cards – Boom!, Reset, Checked, Imaginary, Thunder, and Cubit - have been added to give it a twist!

What’s in the Box
104 total cards
- 44 positive number (1 to 12) cards
- 44 negative number (-1 to -12) cards
- 3 positive and 3 negative imaginary cards
- 2 Boom!, 2 Reset, 2 Checked, 2 Thunder, and 2 Cubit cards

Examples:

If the base card is positive 7, a player could throw a negative 7 card.
(+7) + (-7) = 0

If the base card is positive 7, a player could throw a negative 1, negative 2, and negative 4 cards.
(+7) + (-1) + (-2) + (-4) = 0

If the base card is positive 7, a player could throw a positive 8, negative 10, and negative 5 cards.
(+7) + (+8) + (-10) + (-5) = 0

If the base card is positive 7, a player could throw a negative imaginary card (choose the card to be -11) and a positive 4.
(+7) + (-i) + (+4)= 0

Name: Chronomega
Description:
The year is 2137. The crew and equipment of the Time-Space Research Station, Chronomega One, have been emergency-ejected into outer space. You play one of the surviving scientists who must collect pieces of floating research tech and combine them into Electromagnetic-, Gravity-, and Time-bending tools to help bring Chronomega One back under control. You have no idea which member of the crew is responsible for the emergency protocol lock-down and crew ejection, so you can’t trust any of them!

The player's goal is to collect a full set of the three types of Computer cards (all values 1, 2, 3) to unlock the Station Key Code, and reach the central Computer portal of the station first (and in advanced play, before the station explodes).

The game utilizes a rotating space station board and transparent hexagonal tech cards that represent the four 'suits' of the game, Electromag, Gravity, Chrono, and Computer. The players get three actions each turn to move about the board or play cards. They'll want to collect the floating tech cards during their turn and utilize them for different effects. All the tech cards consist of one of the four suits and are valued 1-3.

If a player encounters another player on the board, they'll utilize their tech cards to engage in a showdown. This consists of each player bidding one of their tech cards. The bids are then revealed and winner determined based on the tech suit played. Certain types of tech defeat others: Electro defeats Grav, Grav defeats Chrono, Chrono defeats Electro. If two types of the same suit are played, higher values defeat lower. All suits defeat Computer, unless their values match (e.g. Grav 3 vs Computer 3), in which case the Computer suit player wins. The winner takes the card that was bid and may push the opposing player 3 spaces (if in outer space), or up or down one level of the space station (including out into an airlock).

All tech cards have a basic function they may be played for as an action, such as move an extra space or to force another player to discard cards. Two transparent tech cards also may be combined and over-layed to activate a catalytic effect, which grants different powers based on the combined card's values and suits. If a full three-part set of tech cards are collected of the same suit (values 1, 2, and 3 of a single suit) they form a POD. These grant the most significant abilities in the game. The more powerful card effects require the player to be standing upon an appropriate research portal to use, either one of the permanent portals within the rotating space station or from a floating portal out in space that they cobbled together from another high-value tech card of the same suit.

The space station itself is surrounded by trapped airlocks which make simply entering the station a risky endeavor. While inside, every time a player ends a turn within the space station their ring level rotates 90 degrees, lining up different portals and pathways with the inter-level Grav chutes. Furthermore, other players may cobble together Electro catalyzers from floating tech cards to try and teleport players into other areas of the station, spend Grav tech to pull cards away from other players, or utilize Chrono tech cards to cause the addition or loss of turns and actions.

Once a player with a full hand of Computer cards reaches the inner Computer Portal of the station, they deactivate Chronomega One’s self-destruct sequence and win the game.

Name: FourCuatro
Description:
The Gateway to Card Gaming: FourCuatro is a 2-player competitive card game for teens and adults.
You cast spells to defeat your opponent and use defensive traps to counter their spells against you. There are multiple paths to victory.

The game includes complex decision making and layers of thinking, especially if you play the “draft” or “constructed” formats.

To play the basic format, you must shuffle the 66 card deck and pass out 33 to each player. Revealing the bottom card will show who goes first. On your turn, you cast a spell, and your opponent may or may not try to block it with a trap. Spells are placed based on mana energy available to the players. A player loses the game when they must draw a card, but they cannot. The complete instructions (including constructed format instructions) are found in the deck or on the website.

Name: Wasted Youth
Description:
Wasted Youth is a satirical look at the things we obsessed over when we were young, possibly still do for some of us.  Have you ever gotten so caught up in collecting comic books that your forgot they are supposed to be read. Have you ever bought a toy but never touched it once because it has to stay mint on card. Then Wasted Youth is about you.

Wasted youth is a simple collection mechanic. Each player tries arrange collections and empty their hand first. The twist are the event cards. Event cards let you steal other players scored collections, set them back to square one or just twist them up in general.

Name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shadows of the Past – Hero Pack: Casey Jones
Description:
Description from the publisher:

The latest Hero Pack for Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shadows of the Past is here! This Hero Pack allows you to use Casey Jones as a playable Hero in any base game scenario and also contains an additional Adventure Comic with four new missions!

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shadows of the Past is a miniatures combat, scenario-driven campaign game that features story content from the IDW TMNT comic. Taking the role of their favorite Turtle or the ultimate villain Shredder, players battle their way through a series of 60-90 minute missions in which they develop their characters' strengths, fighting styles, and equipment along the way to create a lasting story arc.
Families: Comic Books: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

Name: Scream or Die
Description:
Cursed by a witch on Halloween Night, Scream or Die lets you and your friends take on the roles of up to 8 mischievous monsters as they compete for candy to lift the witch's curse.

Scream or Die is a dice game where you control the roll even when you aren't rolling!  Each turn, one player randomly draws dice from a bag and rolls them, but all players can use Screams, the monster's currency, to affect the roll.

If you don't like the dice, add more. If you don't like the roll, shake it up!

At the end of the turn, collect your candy, collect your screams and pass the bag of dice to the next monster at the table. Scream or Die is for 2-8 players and last 15-25 minutes.

Name: Heroes Cove: Apothecary
Description:
This adds an additional Shop and Quests to go along with it!
There is also a Race and Class to add more unique ways to play.

Syrenall has made Heroes Cove her home and she is trying to help young Adventurers (Players) become the best. In order to gain notoriety Adventurers risk it all. Syrenall is there to provide needed potions, for a price of course.

Name: Heroes Cove: Clockworks
Description:
Adds a Shop and Quests to go with it.
Adds a new Race and Class to expand Heroes Cove.

Demmr’th has decided to open up his own shop. He was once known as a locksmith, but due to some misunderstandings that caused the death of many a Knight, Demmr’th had promised to never work as a locksmith again... but he didn't say anything about working as a Clocksmith!

Name: Peacock Block
Description:
Peacock Block is a 3 to 5 player "Take That!" styled card game where players take on the role as Peacocks at a rager of a party, trying to score the love of the peahen by Flirting, Growing Tail Feathers, and presenting "The Ring". However it won't be easy, players on their turn will stop at nothing to Block each other with insults, Pluck tail feathers, and cause all kinds of shenanigans.

Peacock Block has 2 game modes: Normal play, and an extended game which utilizes the Love Meter. The extended game is fantastic for tournaments, and adds even more strategy to the game.

For those who like it even more dirty, there is the 2 part expansion called "The Dirty Bird" Expansion, which adds a 6th player to the fun, and the other part adds interchangeable cards that are Not Safe For Work...or ANYWHERE!

There is also a 2 Player Mode.

PEACOCK BLOCK IS SOLD IN 155 STORES ACROSS 46 STATES IN THE USA!
