Name: Terraforming Mars: Snow Algae Promo Card
Description:
.
THE WATER released to the Martian surface will meet an extremely dry and cold environment, instantly freezing and forming glaciers. Water vapor will sublimate from the ice on warmer summer days, and soon fall back again as snow. This new environment is perfect for snow algae! Inside the ice and snow, they are protected from cold, dryness, and radiation, while creating their own micro-environment using heat from cellular reactions and increased light absorption when making the ice darker.

SNOW ALGAE spread slowly, but contribute at the same time to the biosphere, oxygen production, and heat trapping.

THIS PROMO CARD may be used together with Terraforming Mars. Simply shuffle one copy into the big project deck and hope that you'll be the one to take advantage of the Martian snow!

[Source: Publisher, in spielbox magazine]
.

Terraforming Mars: Spielbox 2/17 Promo. Was also available as a reward for backing The Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast Kickstarter 2017 Campaign and the Man vs Meeple Kickstarter 2018 Campaign. Can now be purchased on the BGG Store.

Snow Algae

Automated Card

Requirements: 2 oceans minimum

Increase plant production and heat production one step.

Promo card 211

Name: Westfront: Tabletop Game for the First World War
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Westfront is a company to battalion level game for WW1 forces, designed for 1/72, 15mm or 10mm miniatures. Smaller scales could also be used.

Westfront is designed with simplicity in mind, but since it represents communication issues, orders from above, random events like units becoming lost, as well as the actual movement and attacking of the various types of forces, it can become quite in-depth.

Westfront has a fairly free-form army list composition; allowing players to choose infantry, cavalry, vehicles, various types of artillery, fortifications and barbed wire at their will. Units behave historically, and 4 different theaters are available to play in. Some will have a higher chance of poor weather, and if the entire tabletop is mud units like armored cars simply wont be able to function. Thankfully season is determined before players write their army lists, so they will know ahead of time what to expect.

Westfront covers the evolution of the war and the changes in doctrines and units involved;

Early war (1914 - 1915) will have only the most rudimentary artillery usage in preliminary bombardments, and only the basic units available (no tanks!).

Mid War (1916) will see the standardization of the creeping artillery barrage (which really works in-game: artillery provides cover as troops advance, and causes enemies to keep their heads down if it explodes near them), indirect machine gun fire and of course the introduction of the first Mk.I tanks.

Late war (1917 - 1918) will see advanced infantry tactics like Germans advancing machine gun teams through creeping barrages to set up in no mans land, and the introduction of more refined tanks and German anti-tank rifles.

Westfront provides army lists for the Allied forces and the Central Powers, covering most of the units available. 3 qualities of infantry and cavalry are available (sup-par, regular and assault/veterans), and artillery is broken into 4 categories: Trench mortars like the minenwerfer or stokes mortar, flat-firing field guns like the 37mm maxim, and the various 77mm German guns (these have varying ranges depending on the specific gun), howitzer batteries like the 18-Pdr or 15cm SFH, and heavy howitzers like the 42cm Mörser or the BL 12-Inch. Fortifications are covered, with shallow and deep trenches, dug outs and pillboxes all available

Westfront aims to give fun games around 2 hours long and to give a WW1 feel for the players. Much research has been done based on the accounts of actual combatants, attempting to implement some of the important features for those on the ground. For example a forward unit on the attack may start to run low on ammunition, so could send a runner back to request supplies, but the runner may get killed along the way... Another example might be a friendly unit capturing an enemy trench, only to get shelled by friendly artillery controlled by H.Q. They desperately send a runner back to their lines to tell the barrage to stop, but it will take a few turns for the order to get through...

Name: Captain America: Civil War
Description:
Try on the role one of the super heroes of Marvel Universe.

The game is starting from the 7 cards in your hands from the base deck plus 6 cards with super powers. Your goal is to get rid of all. The base cards are ridding in the drop's decks by colors or cost. Super powers could change the balance of the match. The winner is the first one whose hand is empty.

Name: Mutant Chronicles Collectible Miniatures Game: Golem of Ice
Description:
The deadly new demon faction, Ilian, receives reinforcements with the release of the Undying Legions for the Mutant Chronicles Collectible Miniatures Game. Between the chilling powers of the brutish Ice Golem and Ilian's relentless Undead Legionnaires, no faction is safe!

This fixed Warband pack contains the imposingly large, double-based Ilian Ice Golem figure, as well as Undead and Cursed Legionnaires, all-new Command Cards, four new Unit cards, and a sheet of Ice tokens.

Name: Mutant Chronicles Collectible Miniatures Game: Karak's Curse
Description:
Karak's Curse provides the dramatic addition of the dangerous heretic Karak to the war-torn Mutant Chronicles universe. As the first unit from the new Ilian faction, Karak wields a powerful, disciple-creating ability that ensures he'll never fight alone and an all-new fortification piece that'll change the way players build their armies!

This fixed Warband pack for use with the Mutant Chronicles Collectible Miniatures Game comes complete with a large, double-based Karak the Keeper Ilian figure, 10 all-new Command Cards, and a terrain-fortification piece (Karak's Command Tent).

Name: Wartime Easy Money
Description:
While Canadian publisher Somerville clearly licenced the name Easy Money from Milton Bradley, it published a very different version of MB's 1935 game during WWII and for a short period of time afterwards (dropping the word wartime from the title). The Monopoly-like mechanics are the same: roll and move, buy properties and businesses and make money. In this version of Easy Money a player keeps playing/moving their token until throwing a “seven”.

While the MB board had 48 spaces, the wartime Canadian game has only 28 spaces (six spaces and only two properties per side plus four corner spaces labelled "Town Square" (start); Hospital; Victory Bonds; and Income Tax. In addition, there is an inner Chance Circle of 24 spaces, each tied to one of the side spaces. Players who throw doubles on 2D6 take the result from the corresponding inner circle space without moving, and then roll again.

The theme of wartime sacrifices is strongly represented: even when collecting $200 for passing the Town Square, $100 must be donated to the Victory Bond space, and a player landing on Victory Bonds takes only half the money there. There also are spaces for Blackout Regulations, Air Raid Defense Plan, Soldiers Welfare Project, War Project and Red Cross Project on the outer square, and spaces for Buy War Savings Stamps and Extra Call for Victory Bonds on the inner circle.

Name: Ethnos: Promo Tribe – Fairies
Description:
The Ethnos: Promo Tribe - Fairies Pack adds a new race to the base game of Ethnos by designer Paolo Mori and artist John Howe.

Adding this promo pack to your base game allows you to create a Band of Allies with a Fairy Leader. When played, you may choose to swap it with a Band of the same size (or smaller) that one of your opponents played previously.

Name: Family Business: Kingpins of Crime promo expansion
Description:
As your mob grows smaller, each of your mobsters get a bigger slice of the pie.  With that ability comes some extra perks.

This promo is a two-page rules variant for Family Business published in Game Trade Magazine (Issue 188 - Oct 2015) as "Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #22".

Name: Monopoly: Alice in Wonderland Collector's Edition
Description: This game is a version of Monopoly with the theme from the 2010 movie version of Alice in Wonderland directed by Tim Burton. This has different pieces with figures from the film, and the board has pictures from the movie. The box size is the same as most other collectable versions of Monopoly.
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Children
Description:
Description from the publisher:

The Story

Thornhill Mansion holds many secrets. Just before the turn into the 20th century Irwin Biddle purchased the house and turned it into what he called an orphanage care facility. But his severe governorship of the orphanage made the home for lost children anything but a haven. A fire in 1939 nearly destroyed the Thornhill Mansion. All but 13 children escaped the blaze. It wasn't until 1956 that Arthur Holland, a mining tycoon, purchased the Thornhill and footed the bill for a full renovation. However, it became clear within weeks of moving his family into the Thornhill that the Victorian mansion was far from settled. Holland's personal account of his family's stay in the Thornhill tells of unexplained children's voices, the sounds of little feet running through the night, of moaning heard inside the walls, even of parts of the house shifting. After leaving the Thornhill, Holland declared, "The place is a house of the dead. No sane person can live well within its walls."

13 ghosts live in the Thornhill, victims of the devastating fire that happened so long ago. As a ghost hunter, you welcome the chance to stay in the ghostly orphanage. Will you be the one to finally put the children to rest? Or will the malevolent child spirits drive you insane?

How to Play

In Children the game, you wander around the Thornhill Mansion trying to trap ghosts.

At the beginning of the game, you deal the 13 Ghosts deck face down off to the side on the table. You then deal the 13 Toys cards face up over the 13 Ghosts cards, creating 13 2-card stacks. Each player gets 5 cards (the hand limit at the beginning of the game) from the Children deck.

Players collectively build the Thornhill Mansion during their turns by placing room cards face up on the table in a grid pattern. The mansion is built in 4 levels--basement, 1st floor, 2nd floor, and 3rd floor. Each room card indicates on which floor it must be placed.

You search for toys and helpful devices by moving your pawn from room to room throughout the mansion. Each time you enter a room, you draw a card and add it to your hand. With a 5-card hand limit, players are forced to leave cards in rooms by placing them facedown beneath room cards. Players may also leave traps beneath room cards. You look at left-behind cards when you enter rooms. Left-behind traps spring immediately. You may add other left-behind cards to your hand.

You place ghost cards into the mansion when they appear at the top of the draw pile. Ghost cards are placed face up beneath room cards so players can read ghosts' names and see the toy icons on the tops of the cards.

To trap ghosts you must have Toy cards. Each ghost card is marked with a toy icon. If you are in a room with a ghost and you have its corresponding toy in your hand, you immediately trap the ghost and put it, along with the toy card, in front of you to keep score.

When you trap a ghost, you must see if another ghost in the house becomes enraged. To do this, flip over the 2-card stack you made at the beginning of the game that corresponds with the toy you used to trap the ghost. If the revealed ghost is in the mansion, flip its card over to its enraged (red) side. Every enraged ghost in the house reduces the hand limit by 1 card. If the hand limit reaches 0 cards, no players win. The ghosts take the game.

Name: Bakumatsu Kyoto Souran
Description:
A game covering the struggle among Edo-bakuhu and Son-noh factions in Kyoto area.

Each player control any one of Aizu-faction, Sin-sen-gumi, Tyousyu-faction, and Son-noh group.
Each player has a different goal in this game.  Aizu and Tyousyu are evaluated by support value.  On the other hand, Sin-sen-gumi is evaluated by control of areas and Son-noh group is evaluated by placement of their bases.

1 game map. 4 player aid sheets. 1 countersheet.



Issue game of Game Journal #61.
Families: History: Boshin War & Meiji Era Rebellions

Name: Mothership: Into the Vortex
Description:
Nebula tiles: Add another element to your board with Nebula tiles. Ships can only move a maximum of 1 space through nebula but won't take damage. This simple new element adds an entirely new layer of strategy when paired with...

Wormholes: Two way wormholes transport ships instantly to the other side creating new ways to play. Flip them over to reveal black Wormholes that can have more than one exit.

Class Cards: Receive a random Class card at the beginning of the game to further specialize your fleet. Each card has a one-use action ability and technology upgrade that no one else has. With up to eight different Classes, there's something to suit any play style.

Name: Atticus Scroll: Journey of the Pharaoh
Description:
In 1837, British Egyptologist, John Atticus discovers a clay jar in the Egyptian desert. When he opens the jar, he finds an ancient scroll written in hieroglyphs. He translates the scroll which contains the one true way for a Pharaoh to navigate from this world to the afterlife. It was the Journey of the Pharaoh.

Object of the Game
You are the designated Vizier and must help your Pharaoh navigate successfully the journey from this world to the afterlife.  Beware of the many challenges and pitfalls that may impede your Pharaoh’s path.  Acquire amulets along the way for protection and avoid the deadly clutches of the Ammit.

As players progress around the game board, they will pass the Scarab Sun.  Once a player passes the Scarab Sun, he/she should take a card and follow the instructions of the card.  If a player retreats or trades places with another, then do not draw a card.  Replace the card on the bottom of the deck when done.

Each icon on the game board has an associated action to it.

To win the game, a player must roll the die and advance the exact number of spaces needed to reach the Ra (sun) symbol.  If the exact number is not rolled, then the player stays in the same position.

Name: Tapaono
Description:
The objective of this strategy game is to have conquered more fields than the opponent at the end of the game. Various game modes (victory conditions) are available. Played on a play area with 151 hexagonal squares, of which 139 can be conquered. Each player receives three tokens and 100 field marks. The game is turn-based. Each turn consists of the following four phases:
 1. Move 2. Draw commands-cards 3. Capture by rolling 4. Capture by commands,
 which are always played in this order.
When a player has completed his turn, the second player has his turn. This is repeated until one of the players has won the game mode determined by both players at the beginning. 
The player has to move each of his token one field every turn. He rooling the dice for each token and destinkt so how many fields he can conquer surround his token. If the player roll a five he can conquer or free five fields.   
The player conquer free fields or free conquered fields. If a field with a token is conquerd, the token go back to the spawn.  
Each time a player move on one of the 12 fields with a star (wich can not be conquerd) he has to draw a command-card.
With this command-cards he can supply for example his movement, instead of one movement turn per token he has by playing the command "move +1" two turns for one token. The command-cards are very different. Some have supply effects for the movement other supply the conquering and others are traps with negative effects. Some of the command-cards ask the player to roll the dice. For example how many fields a player lose by drawing a trap-card.
Some commands (max 5)can be collected in the "depot" and played as a chain.

There is also an assist app available in Google Playstore

Name: Malwarium
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Malwarium is a Dixit-inspired competitive storytelling game. The active player secretly chooses a card from their hand and makes up a word, sentence, or quote that might describe it. Other players contribute cards from their hands to produce a pool of candidates (along with the active player's card). Players then choose which card was the active player's and points are awarded. Some spaces on the scoring track provide restrictions on how the active player may describe their card (if they are on such a space).

Name: Fleeting Glory
Description: Fleeting Glory allows one to conduct abstracted battles in the Napoleonic era. Hidden information and a chit pull system effectively allow solitaire or head to head play. The game takes its inspiration from Napoleon's Triumph, Battles of Napoleon, Stratego etc. and spits out a rules foot print of less than 10 pages. Play time permits multiple engagements in a single afternoon. Experience a marriage of skill and chance that enables one to build tactical puzzles similar to those the commanders of old faced.

Name: Picture It!
Description:
Ready...Set...Sketch!
Quickly draw sketches based on a category like "Board game parts". You will go crazy tryimg to read your partner's mind and sketch at the same time. But,when time is up you and your partner check to see if your sketches match. When you see the ridiculous sketches, you'll see there's nothing sketchy about how much fun it is to play!

Name: Seagull Splat
Description:
Descrption from the publisher:

Seagull Splat is a mischievous and hilarious children's Game that will have kids screaming with laughter as they poop their way through victory. Each player receives a set of beach towels and takes it in turn to fly the Seagull over the towels. Are you lucky enough to dodge that poop? You may end up popped out if you aren't?

Box Contains 1 Seagull 1x75ml seagull foam solution 4x 4 character cards (1 red / 1 orange / 1 green / 1 blue)x 1 spinner label x 1 base x1 spinner arrow.

A mischievous and hilarious children's game. Each player receives a set of beach towels. Take it in turns to fly the Seagull over the towels. Are you lucky enough to dodge that poop? You may end up pooped out if you aren't.

Name: 発見！ねこロジー (Hakken! Nekology)
Description:
Discovered! Cat Roji(ç™ºè¦‹ï¼ã­ã“ãƒ­ã‚¸ãƒ¼)

The hidden covers of the cats will start!
You should not be distracted by mice once again.
Read the other's psychology and find hidden cats!
The cat who did not find anyone until the end won!

â–  Hide the cat before starting the game

Each player receives a total of seven hands, including one "cat"
Let's sort in any order.
The initial placement is the strategy's point of where to put "cat" at first.
The game starts when sorting is over!

â–  What to do on the turn is "â‘  Search for cats" ⇒ "â‘¡ effect of card effect" ⇒ "â‘¢ escape cat"

â‘  Search for cats
Please draw 1 card from the hand of the player next to the left.
Let's think carefully where the other concealed the cat.

â‘¡ Handle the effect of the drawn card
Put the card you drew into the far left of your hand and activate the effect.
There are six kinds of card effects, such as "Footprints" handing the rightmost hand and "Tatari" that my hands end immediately.

â‘¢ Escape the cat
Finally, move any one of your hands to the far left of your hand.
Is the moved card a "cat"? Is it?

â–  Let's hide until the end

The player who found "cat" drops out of the game.
The player who did not find "cat" until the end will be the winner!

â–  Easy card games without tables required

There is no deck or deck, and it has become a game that will advance with your hand alone.
You do not need to use a table, and because the playing time is short, you can enjoy it anytime and anywhere!

· 28 cards
· 1 instruction sheet

Name: Wizards of the Wild: Forbidden Forest
Description:
Description from the publisher:

The Wizards of the Wild ventured deeper into the forest! Exotic creatures from across the globe and strange magically charged artifacts add new special abilities to your Wizards, playing off opponents and creating a brand new experience!

The Forbidden Forest Expansion adds brand new cards including the new familiar card type, new spells and new challenges to Wizards of the Wild!

Familiars are special, double-sided cards with TWO abilities. The new FLIP mechanic lets you use one side of the card, and then activate the more powerful scoring side to rack up the points!

The Forbidden Forest expansion also includes new spells and challenges that work with the familiars and the base game to create new combos!

Name: 6-Tage-Rennen
Description:
Each player has 2 bicycles. Movement is determined by one die. The players start at the colored spaces (Spitzengruppe) in the center of the game board. The game consists of 6 racing days á 2 spurts. Each spurt consists of one lap around the track by one bicycle. Points are awarded for each spurt. Players who get outstripped change from "Spitzengruppe" to "1 Runde zurück" and so on.
Winner is the player in "Spitzengruppe" who gets the most points.

Name: Hasch' mich auf der Autobahn
Description:
Each player gets 1 car. Movement is determined by a standard die (1-6) and a color die (red, blue, green). The color die indicates the direction of movement at the crossroads (red = left, blue = right, green = any). If movement starts in a city, any direction can be chosen. There are 5 different kinds of play:

1) Hasch' mich auf ter Autobahn: The players start in the center space (Berlin) and try to catch one another. The last player on the board wins the game.

2) Fuchsjagd: One player (Fox) is hunted by all the other players. The fox has to reach all cities marked with "F" to win the game. Any player who catches the fox has to assume the role of the fox, while the former fox is eliminated from the game. The last hunter wins the game, if he catches the fox before he has reached all his destinations.

3) Sternfahrt: The players start from a city marked with "St". The first player to reach the center space (Berlin) wins the game.

4) Streckenrekord: The players starr from Berlin and try to get as far from there as possible. Each player who returns to Berlin is eliminated from the game. The last player on the board wins the game.

5)Grenzfahrt: The players start in a city marked with "G" and have to travel to all other cities marked with "G". The first player to achieve this and returns to his starting city wins the game.

The game was published between 1936 and 1945.

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): The Bright Crusaders – Human Blood Bowl Team
Description:
Description from the publisher:

The Bright Crusaders could be a truly great Blood Bowl team, if it wasn’t for one serious handicap – they never, ever, cheat! While other teams are preparing for the match by bribing referees, the Bright Crusaders are performing charity matches – a fact that will stop them winning a major tournament until they shape up and learn to play dirty!

Should you be feeling a little less killtacular than most Blood Bowl coaches, and just want to play for the love of the game, this is the Human team for you! You’ll receive 12 plastic Human Blood Bowl players – 2 Throwers, 2 Catchers, 2 Blitzers and 6 Linesmen – with a set of resin head and torso parts used to upgrade them to the Bright Crusaders. The kit includes the options for 2 helmetless Linesmen, a helmetless Blitzer and a helmetless Thrower, as well as a pair of Bright Crusaders coins and 2 turn markers. Sadly, the kit does not include a participation medal…

This 72-component kit comes as 40 plastic and 32 resin parts supplied with 12 32mm Blood Bowl bases and the Bright Crusaders team roster.

Name: Wer wird Bibel-Quizionär?
Description: Its a game about the bible. There are a lot of questions from the New and the old Testament. Who is the first on the aim?

Name: Realms of Destiny
Description:
Realms Of Destiny is a fantasy adventure board game for 1 to 8 players. Realms Of Destiny can be played head-to-head, cooperatively, solo, or teams.

Players choose their Character, Allegiance, and starting Guild, then explore the board using equipment, treasure, and spells to wander the map, complete quests, capture bounties, meet both allies and foes on the road, build a traveling party, and earn Destiny to claim Blessings and fight whichever Tyrant is harrowing the land for that game session. Even in coop mode, players each have their own adventures, while trading to aid one another, then come together for the final boss battle.

Name: 50 Overs Cricket
Description:
Board game that simulates limited over cricket.

It can be played by any even number of players (teams), but is ideally suited to two players. Each player bats and bowls for one innings (50 overs).

Once play order is established the bowler determines the type of bowler for the next over by a dice roll. They then place their fielders on the board in setting that matches this type of bowler. Then outcome (and runs scored) of each delivery is determined by drawing a card from a deck of cards. Each card has six possible outcomes, however the outcome is determined by the bowler type (fixed for this over) and therefor is typical to a batsmen playing a delivery from that type of bowler. A well placed field by the bowler should ensure lower scores from the batting team.

Each over consists of four deliveries, so each innings is therefore 200 balls.

The game can be played with or without a scoresheet as a simple magnetic scoring grid (with markers) is printed on the game board.

The winner is the player who amasses the most runs.

From the rules booklet "To play a Board game of cricket in the true spirit of the cricketing tradition. To foster a deeper interest and understanding of the tactical skill required in the National summer sport."

Manufactured & Published locally in NZ by F.T. Connor (Blenheim)

Contents

1 Game Board
100 Cards
9 Fielding Tokens
1 Standard Die
1 Rulebook
1 Pad of score sheets
3 Scoring tokens

Name: Heroes of Land, Air & Sea: Order and Chaos
Description: Expands Heroes of Land, Air & Sea to support 5 and 6 players. Features a game board extension, components for the 5th and 6th player and 4 additional factions: the Undead, the Lionkin, the Lizardfolk and the Goblins.
Families: Game: Heroes of Land, Air & Sea

Name: Sunship: A Game of Celestial Creation and Conquest
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Sunship is a game designed for 2-4 players. The board is divided into 8 orbits and an impenetrable asteroid belt. The orbits are further divided into regions of varying economic and strategic value. Additionally, there are 5 transit hubs which facilitate jumping between orbits. The  object of the game is to eliminate the other players through conquest or, alternatively, to successfully monopolize all transit hubs for an economic victory.

Holding regions of space are the source of income in the game. The value of regions can be increased by constructing and upgrading space stations. To protect valuable regions, force fields may be constructed. Isolating regions behind force fields, however, diminishes their economic output. A player must, therefore, strike a careful balance between security and trade.

Players may attack adjacent regions with their fleets of space ships. There are three types of space ships in Sunship. Combat is played out on special cards on which the placement of space ships is significant. Depending on the type of ship, the player may select difficult to hit positions, cloak their attack, or attack from the rear. The combat system is elegant, versatile, and based on basic bit math.

Name: Wisdomantics
Description:
From the box
"Wisdomantics - Where Wisdom is Power is an interactive DVD board game for players of various faiths who desire to gain the vast wisdom of King Solomon.  Wisdomantics utilizes the proverbs of Solomon to and blends chance, knowledge and strategy to create a fun experience while you learn."

Wisdomantics is a Biblical trivia game with track movement and set collection.  Players attempt to complete Solomon's Temple by answering trivia questions about the proverbs of Solomon (included on a DVD) and then choosing a card that allows them to move around a track.  As they move, they collect building materials (Gold, Cedar and Cypress) that they use to complete Solomon's Temple on their player board.  Players also collect blessing cards.  Blessing cards or building materials may be trades 3-for-1 for other resources.  The first player to complete his or her temple wins.

Name: Jetta D-1: World Travel Game
Description:
Jetta D-1 World Travel Game is designed to teach geography. 
 "Jetta" is a contraction of JET Travel Adventure.  In this game, each player chooses a travel itinerary that will take them around the world in a series of flights and places their airplane pawn on the world map board.  They then roll two dice repeatedly and add the totals until they reach the exact total required to move their pawn to the next city in their itinerary.  They record how many rolls it took.  The rules do not specify what to do if the roll total goes over the exact amount needed.  When each player has completed his or her itinerary, the player who rolled the dice the fewest times wins.  Players will learn the names and locations of cities as well as airport codes.

Name: Space Travel Game
Description: Space Travel Game was a Jack in the Box kids' meal giveaway.  It is a simple spin-and-move game packaged in a small plastic clamshell box.  The top of the box is a spinner.  Inside is a folded game board with a track leading a space shuttle back to Earth.  Players spin and move their pieces either forward or backward on the track (or lose a turn) as indicated, trying to be the first to reach Earth.  A note on game design:  The spinner is exactly balanced between moving forward and moving backward, and with 40 spaces on the board, this could be a very long game.

Name: Kabigon's Oyamsumi Yurayura Hammock
Description: Players take turns stacking Pikachus on top of a sleeping Snorlax. The game ends when they all come tumbling down off the hammock and the player that caused the tumble loses.

Name: Kickin' Your Ass!: The Drunk Edition
Description:
Description from the publisher:

This is the more drunker edition of the ass grabbin’ Kickin’ Your Ass card game. It is a card game where you try to build your Ass, while kicking other players’ Asses and where getting your Ass kicked means shots!

You try to collect each piece of Ass you can get your hands on. Once you have enough Ass to complete your Ass, you win. But along the way, other players are trying to kick your Ass and force you to drink!. This of course results in you losing your Ass, or at least some of it.

Each player starts with a hand of four cards.  All cards are drawn from a common deck.  You build your Ass out of 5 cards, Tail, Back Legs, Middle, Front Legs, Head.

All the while, you play cards to Kick someone’s Ass which makes them lose pieces of their Ass and drink so it get’s better the more ass you kick.

There are also defensive cards such as Kiss My Ass that will prevent this and force the kicker to drink.

Name: Fields of Arle: Tea & Trade
Description:
Return to East Frisia and bring more variety to your labors in the far North with the Tea & Trade expansion for Fields of Arle! This expansion adds tea — the national beverage of East Frisia — to energize your workers, as well as new ships for trading and fishing. Choose from a bevy of new features to add to your farm, including ditches that dehydrate your land and new buildings that grant you more options for maximizing your yields. With components to add a third player to the game, more players can enjoy the game than ever before. With new buildings, actions, and abilities, Tea & Trade includes everything you need to become a true 19th century farming magnate!

—description from the publisher

Name: Hostage Negotiator: Abductor Pack 8
Description:
Hostage Negotiator: Abductor Pack 8 is a 16-card expansion compatible with both Hostage Negotiator and Hostage Negotiator: Crime Wave.

Samuel Xavier, an angry individual on his best days, was involuntarily forced into a rehabilitation clinic for substance abuse. Now that he's going through withdrawal pains in the form of excruciating migraines he's angrier than he's ever been before.

In this challenging new expansion pack for Hostage Negotiator, you must deal with Sammy's blinding headaches while trying to save hostages. If you can't reduce Sammy's pain to a manageable level he may snap... and then it will be too late to save anyone.

Name: Kriegs-Spiel
Description:
This is a two-player German war game published in about 1880. The playing board features a castle in the center surrounded by a two-layer multi-colored track running from 1-70. On each side is rectangular block of colored numbers, with 1-35 on one side and 36-70 on the other. There are illustrations of fighting in the four corners, with uniforms representing the then-recent Franco-Prussian war of 1870-71.

To start, the players each put an agreed amount into the pot to fund the war. They then take turns rolling a single die, and advancing that many spaces on their respective tracks. The first to reach space 70 wins the war and the pot.

The color of each space has an effect on play. If a player lands on a green space, the opponent must drop back to the nearest red space. A player who lands on a blue space must pay one mark to his opponent. Landing on a gold space means paying a mark into the pot, while landing on a lilac space grants another roll of the die.

The board consists of a sheet of paper pasted onto thick cardboard. A second game is pasted onto the reverse side.

Name: Castle Assault: Fell Fire Forge
Description:
Castle Assault is a unique gaming experience combining the ferocious onslaught of Tower Defense games with the strategic elements of CCGs and progressive advancement of RPG's. Castle Assault seeks to break the mold of traditional card games and organically extracts the most enjoyable parts of these different genres and distill them into a standalone concept. Castle Assault plays in about 30 mins, and is for 1 or 2 Players.

Draft warbands, upgrade heroes and craft legendary weapons as you battle an inferno of horrors on an epic quest to forge your destiny.  As a 100% stand alone Castle Assault expansion that can be 100% integrated into Castle Assault, the Fell Fire Forge introduces 4 new Warbands and an completely epic, non-linear branching solo campaign like you have never seen!

Name: A Voyage of Our Own
Description:
Today is finally your day! 
The emperor finally granted you a permit and even a ship!

In your anticipation you rush to see your magnificent ship and find...

Your 3 rivals already arguing over whose voyage it is!!

In A Voyage of Our Own, you play an intrepid explorer 
forced to share their ship with 1-3 other explorers to explore an unknown archipelago. 
Can you claim more credit for the voyages success?

Or will one of the other explorers steal the glory for 
themselves?

...Set sail and adventure east to the Vooo islands.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
Voyage of Our Own is a light strategy exploration game. Players share the ship's crew to earn more credit for the voyage.  This is done by placing and exploring islands, laying claims on tiles, and collecting tiles in their hands.

Credit is earned by discovering islands, claiming tiles, and gathering sets of trade goods.  The player with the most credit at the end of the game wins.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Voyage of Our Own contains 
24 Hex tiles.
2 Crew
1 Board
1 Cool down chip
60 Claims (15 in 4 colours)

Name: Zuirius
Description:
Zuirius is a strategic board game played on an endless triangular grid. It is possible to play on any flat surface, without the special board. The goal of the game is to block all tetrahedrons of your rival.

In this game there is no captures or direct confrontation of pieces. During the game the number of pieces is not changed, all tetrahedrons are interconnected and constantly depend on each other. The compact starting position of pieces passes through various irreversible metamorphoses and, having exhausted all its "energy", freezes as a result. You can play with 18, 24, 30, 36 or 42 pieces. The more pieces, the harder the game will be.

Rules:

Each player has an allocated color. Players alternate turns. All tetrahedrons must be connected in a single group. You cannot pick up a piece to move if doing so disconnects the remaining pieces, even if they would be reconnected after putting the piece into its new location. Each tetrahedron always has neighbors. Their number can be from 1 to 12. Tetrahedrons are considered to be neighbors if they stand on the nearby triangles. Neighbors are divided into two types - orthogonal and diagonal. The piece can be moved to any empty triangle, where the number of neighbors are less than it is now. Their color does not matter. The piece can also be moved to any empty triangle, where the number of neighbors does not change, but orthogonal ones among them become less. The game ends when one of the players has no legal moves on his turn. In this case, the winner does as many moves as he can and earns one point for each move. When both players lose moves consecutively it's a draw.

Name: Monopoly: Guardians of the Galaxy Volume 2
Description: This game is a version of Monopoly with the theme from the 2017 movie Guardians of the Galaxy Volume 2 directed by James Gunn. This game has custom game board features characters from both films, 6 collectible custom tokens, and custom houses and hotels that are renamed as "gear" and "equipment".

Name: Monopoly Junior: Finding Dory edition
Description: An edition of Monopoly Junior, with Disney/Pixar Finding Dory theme, that features exclusive Finding Dory tokens. The game is like the classic Monopoly game but easier for kids. And it features properties from Disney/Pixar Finding Dory Movie.
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Beyond The Wall Promo
Description:
This White Box Expansion includes a small vignette depicting Aya the Survivor in dangerous times.  This expansion also includes the remaining two gear cards that complete the Vagabond Armor set from 'Before the Wall'.

The gear cards are crafted via recipes printed on the back of them.

These gear cards are:

Hard Breastplate
Leather/Vagabond Set Torso Heavy Armor (3 Armor points)
Affinities: Top; Red Half, Bottom; Blue Half
Automatically Activated ability: Green + Blue Affinity required: Ignore the first severe injury you suffer each showdown

Cloth Leggings:
Vagabond Set Leg Accessory (Legs, 1 Armor)
Affinities: Bottom, Green Half
Passive Ability: When you suffer the Bleeding or Bloody Thighs severe injury, only gain 1 bleeding token)

Note: Cloth Leggings use the starting item 'Cloth' gear card to craft them.

Name: 1705: El desembarcament
Description:
Card game based in the landing of Austriacist troops in Montgat (near Barcelona) in 1705, during the War of the Spanish Succession.

The aim of the players is to get 10 points, playing the best sets of cards. At the peginning of a game, each player gets a special permanent character, which gives some special power). Then from a draw pile, in each turn, a player draws a card and plays as many cards as he wants in his playing area, trying to play the best sets, to either get points or to destroy card sets already played by other players.
Families: History: War of the Spanish Succession

Name: Cy-Co: The Western Cyberpunk Board Game
Description:
Cy-Co is a western cyberpunk strategy game for 2 to 4 players. It combines classical western elements with the cyberpunk style of the 80s.

Alternately Cy-Co and Crime Evil perform their actions. When both players have finished their rounds the civilians move with their own card deck randomly on the game board – trying to escape the villain Crime Evil in panic.

In order to achieve their goals, the players have to strategically outmaneuver each other and thus thwart the machinations of their adversary. Who will prevail in this epic showdown of Cy-Co, the western cyberpunk board game – law or anarchy?

Name: Alle meine Tiere
Description:
Discover, assign and count domestic animals.
It's a tiptoi game for very young players (3 year olds).

Where does the fox live? And what does the hedgehog really love to eat? How well do you know about horses, cats ...? 
With the game "All My Animals" and the tiptoi device you will learn a lot about domestic animals, their habitats, their animal children, and you can playfully get to know more about numbers.

Name: Team Yankee: Iron Maiden
Description:
The British are coming! With its usual professionalism, the British Army had prepared for war. Now, as the Soviet Army flooded across the border into West Germany, it was ready and waiting. Scorpion and Scimitar light tanks skirmished with the Soviet forward detachments as the Chieftain armoured regiments waited. The infantry held the towns and woods, forcing the enemy into killing zones. If anything broke through, the airmobile troops in their Lynx helicopters would hold them. The British Army is ready.

Iron Maiden provides players with Army lists for the “Death or Glory Boys’” Chieftain Armoured Squadron, the Irish Guards’ Mechanised Company, the Gordon Highlanders’ Airmobile Company, and the Queen’s Dragoon Guards’ Medium Recce Squadron, as well as history of the British Army of the Rhine, painting guides and scenarios.

Name: Burst My Bubble
Description:
Burst My Bubble is a family strategy card game. The artwork creates a classic feel, like card games of the 70's. The goal is to score the most points by bursting soap bubbles to collect sets or surviving as the "Bubble Player". A game typically plays in 45 minutes, but can be made longer or shorter by changing the victory point total.

This is a Multi Phase game. In the beginning you play in the Bubble Up Phase, which allows you to draw and play action cards. You are trying to improve your hand to build the most points in the next phase. If you feel like you have a chance to survive as the Bubble Player then Say "Burst" and bring the game into the Burst My Bubble phase (this is where the most points are accumulated).

Name: Milliardending
Description:
Consists of 8 square cards printed on one side with an “X” and on the other side with a “+”. Three of the cards are printed in blue, two in black and three in red. The cards are arranged in a 9 X 9 configuration with the red cards in the upper horizontal row, the black cards in two of the three positions in the middle row and the blue cards in the bottom row. The number and placement of cards marked “X” or  “+” may be random or deliberate.

The object of the game is to move the blue cards to the upper horizontal row and the red cards to the bottom row in the fewest possible moves. The cards displaying an “X” may be moved only diagonally to an unoccupied space. The cards displaying a “+” may be moved only horizontally or vertically to an unoccupied space.

The game may be played as a solitaire or with two or more experienced players.

Name: z3r0d4y
Description:
z3r0d4y — a.k.a. Zero Day, a.k.a. ã‚¼ãƒ­ãƒ‡ã‚¤ — is a competitive game played with one admin facing off against 1-3 hackers. The admin aims to fix vulnerabilities in a computer system before hackers steal too much information.

The admin wins by acquiring a certain number of progress tokens based on the number of players, and to make progress, the admin must perform "operations" multiple times successfully while avoiding interference from hackers. To do so, the admin will rely on timing and must secure sufficient credits.

Each hacker wants to steal information before others can do so (and before the admin fixes the vulnerability, of course), and once a hacker steals a certain amount of information tokens, they win the game immediately. To do this, they need to gather information, interfere with the admin's operation, and install virus proxies.

Name: Dungeon Roll: Henchmen
Description:
Not Everyone Can be a Hero!

You've made it as an adventurer, but now you tire of mundane tasks. Why not hire some help? Henchmen can do your dirty work - as long as you share the treasure. And, should something untoward (perish the thought!) happen to them on the job... well, that`s what clerics are for!

Henchmen is an expansion and rules booster for Dungeon Roll.

Name: Cake Off
Description:
The magical cake baking game for 3 to 6 players.

You are an apprentice wizard at Hestias Cakes, the most magical cake shop in all the land. You’ve been learning how to make cakes for while now… but one day the Arch-Cakier, Erimines, comes down with a case of Bog Rot Flu, which leaves you (the players) to bake the cakes and get the orders out to the hungry customers who want their sweet treats by the end of the day.

Objective
The players receive a random number of cake orders every day that they have to bake. With 7 cards dealt from the Cake Deck, they choose 1 and pass the rest to the left. These cards are ingredients which they can use to bake those cakes at the end of the turn.

But there's a difference: each ingredient card has a different magical power that will allow them to manipulate the ingredients available to them.

Cake Off - the ultimate magical pick and pass game!

Name: BattleCON: Shekhtur Malephaise – Daemonic Princess Costume
Description: A new Unique Ability with alternative art for Shekhtur Lenmorre from BattleCON: Devastation of Indines.

Name: BattleCON: Eligor Larington – Golden Templar Costume
Description: An new Unique Ability with alternative art for Eligor Larington from BattleCON: Devastation of Indines.

Name: BattleCON: Kallistar Flarechild – Ice Elemental Costume
Description: An new Unique Ability card with alternate art for Kallistar Flarechild from BattleCON: War of Indines.

Name: BattleCON: Hikaru Sorayama – Defender of Justice Costume
Description: An new Unique Ability card with alternate art for Hikaru Sorayama from BattleCON: War of Indines.

Name: BattleCON: Hikaru Sorayama – World Warrior Costume
Description: An new Unique Ability card with alternate art for Hikaru Sorayama from BattleCON: War of Indines.

Name: BattleCON: Luc Von Gott – Leader of the Four Heroes Costume
Description: An new Unique Ability card with alternate art for Luc Von Gott from BattleCON: War of Indines.

Name: BattleCON: Karin Brandtford – Terror of Kor Karoli Costume
Description: An new Unique Ability card with alternate art for Karin & Jager from BattleCON: Devastation of Indines.

Name: BattleCON: Cadenza – Space Invader Costume
Description: An new Unique Ability card with alternate art for Cadenza from BattleCON: War of Indines.

Name: Fleet Ambush
Description:
In Fleet Ambush, two players will take control of a fleet each, Humans Vs. Aliens. At the start of the game, both players construct a fleet of ships using square pieces. Your ships can be armed with many weapons, including ion cannons, fighter bays, turrets and more!

Once both players have constructed their fleet, the two fleets will battle it out the cold dark depths of space! Each player takes turns activating their ships, moving and then firing! You can also use your fighters to create a fighter screen, blocking your ships from your enemies weapon systems!

To win, you will need to disable all of your opponents ships, or have more standing at the end of 10 rounds. Let the best Admiral win!

Full instructions to PnP and play are here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/18h-WMTEOyfyf5At1PZwqjYJRNHouzVJKbM_FX-0v-_I/view

Name: Greenest
Description:
Greenest is the third game of the Green-Greener-Greenest set. Green, Greener and Greenest are three games that use the same set of components.

Greenest is a game for 1 player with the same mechanism as Green.

Depending on the set, you’d have:

Basic: a 6×6 board, 15 black pyramids, 20 green pyramids, 15 white pyramids.

Advanced: a 6×9 – 9×9 board (using one or both pads), 30 black pyramids, 45 green pyramids, 30 white pyramids.

Gameplay overview:

The board starts full of pyramids.

- Black can only capture Green
- Green can only capture White
- White can only capture Black

The goal of the game is to end up with a single stack, by making captures also as in Green (Black can only capture Green and so on), but in any order. This is, you can capture several times with the same colour, or reverse the order.

Whether all initial configurations are solvable or not still remains an open question. Your feedback on this will be greatly appreciated.

Please refer to the rulebook for detailed rules.

Name: You Bet-Cha!
Description:
You Bet-Cha! combines poker, trivia, chance and a race against the clock into an exciting game night!  Lively categories will have you competing to name everything from members of the Detroit Bad Boys to Hotels on the Las Vegas Strip.

Don't bet off more than you can chew, or you'll be adding to your opponents' chip stack.  An amusing mix of knowledge, quick thinking and betting strategy, You Bet-Cha!, is the perfect game for tabletop lovers, trivia enthusiasts and high rollers!

OBJECTIVE:

Be the player with the most chips after seven rounds

HOW TO PLAY:

-Ante up
-Roll the dice to determine category and type of game (live bet, silent bet or all play)
-Place your bets
-High bidder has one minute to give answers to subject
-Collect or surrender your chips
-Repeat!

Name: Hot-Pota-toH!
Description:
Hot-Pota-toh! is a press your luck game where the deck has an exploding potato that players must avoid drawing, while trying to get the cards that have "Phew" points. The deck will be rotated among the players and each player will draw a card or play a card until someone draws the Hot-Pota-toh! Card and explodes, losing the points accumulated, then a new round begins. The best part of the game are the power cards which cointain other press your luck and hot potato mechanics!

A game in the genre of Exploding Kittens, yet the change in the scoring systems and victory conditions, and the press your luck mechanisms within the game make Hot-Pota-toH! a game in its own right!

Name: Unfairy
Description:
Description from the designer:

Unfairy is a game where each player assumes the role of a peculiar fairy tale character who wants to be the hero of its own tale. Fight against popular fairy tales characters and win magical items that will get you stronger by stealing and annoying your opponents. At the start of the game every player gets a character and a characteristic that changes the way the player will have to play that match. You can play as a hysterical fairy, a faint-hearted knight or a headless mage. There are 400 different combinations to play with.

In Unfairy each player receives 5 cristals that works as its attributes and are used as resources to, in alternate turns, activate their magical items, fight encounters, steal from its opponents and search for the objective encounter to fight it and win the game before your opponents.

Name: La Caída de Hispania
Description:
La Caída de Hispania ("The Fall of Spain") is a game for 2 to 4 players.

Every player takes the role of one of the factions (hispanoroman,Visigoths, Suevi and Barbarians)to get their historical goals.

Factions coexist, fight and interact in the final era of the Roman Empire represented by the marker of the fall of Rome.

Players get victory points occupying "conventus" (geographic areas). 
To get the victory every player has a group of "huestes" (armies) on the board and a treasure trove of "mites"(roman coins) to negotiate and gain advantages.

The turns are developed with a card engine, generics for all players and specific for differente factions.

At the end of the game, the faction with more Victory Points will be the winner and the prize will be to rule Hispania.

Name: Chemikum
Description:
Chemikum is a journey of discovery into the world of elements.

For 2-6 players from 10 to 99 years. Playing time: 4 players approx. 40 min.

Chemikum - a communication game that aims to inspire children and young people for chemistry. With fun, joy and happiness, step by step knowledge points are collected to reach the Bachelor or Master's degree.

Chemikum is a very simple board game that integrated the periodic table of the elements.

In a unique mix of knowledge and advice game, up to 6 players fight to get points for a bachelor's degree. In another round, the Master's degree can be earned.

The two-sided printed schedule offers 2 difficulty levels:
PSE with long name (lighter) or PSE only with short description of the elements. CHEMIKUM also provides the incentive, for all levels of knowledge, to take the opportunity to discover the chemistry, together with the possibility of compiling the difficulty level by selecting the question cards themselves.

In four card categories, a wide range of chemistry is presented:

PASSWORD:
Difficult to pronounce chemical compounds (for correct pronouncement one gets points), which are briefly explained on the map;

ACTION:
simple way to collect points or lose, there is reward and with luck you can get closer to the target field

PSE-KNOWLEDGE:
This question category is linked to the PSE indoor playfield

ALLTAGS-WISSEN-CHEMIE:
Questions about the chemistry. Many have contributed to this question category: children, adults, grandpa and grandma. It makes us aware that the chemistry of our everyday life is an integral part of life.

Name: War in the Megacity
Description:
"War in the Megacity" is a two-player simulation of hypothetical near-future battles fought in metropolitan areas with populations of 10 million or more, and it’s designed by Joseph Miranda. The objective is to show the spectrum of conflict — conventional, special operations and unconventional — used in this type of fighting on the grand-tactical level. There are two sides, both controlled by a player, the Insurgent, who wants to seize control of the city. Opposing him in that effort is the Government player.

The “Infowar Index” is central to play. Each player has one, which indicates how successful he is in achieving his goals — and representing the amount of overall public support each side is getting.

Each game turn represents from two days to two weeks of ‘real time,’ depending on the tempo and scope of the activities conducted in each one. The various units represent force sizes – most either task-organized or spontaneously generated at street-level – varying in size between battalions and brigades: anywhere from about 500 to 5,000 personnel.

Megacity has a number of unusual subsystems. For one, victory in battle isn’t always reckoned in terms of physically destroying the enemy but, rather, in fighting him in such a way as to get the media’s reporting squarely on your side. Another important aspect of the game is that certain combat results cause units to get stronger, as they gain in cohesion and tactical expertise.

The system has antecedents in earlier games, in particular, Jim Dunnigan's “Chicago, Chicago!” It presented the first wargame approach to confrontations between police and demonstrators during the protests at the 1968 Democratic National Convention in Chicago. It was one of the first attempts to model modern urban warfare, albeit in a “battle” in which no one was killed though there was plenty of havoc in the streets.

Counterfact magazine #9

Name: Castles & Dragons Board Game
Description:
A strategy game with strong economy aspects.
 You begin as a Lord of one realm and try to conquer the rest of the world by using your deadly armies or by uniting kingdoms to form a country.
Test yourself in a supply and demand market. Create pacts with other lords to make your way to the crown faster and easier, then break them and destroy opponents by sending spies to their lands. Expand your kingdom by building villages and cities. Protect it by raising castles and wizard towers. Every move you take influences the happiness of your people. When it reaches the top you can form a country, but when it falls to the ground your people will assassinate you. Will you accept the challenge?
â€‹
Rule book will be in three different languages: English, Polish,  and Italian

Object of the Game

The object of the game is to “Form a country”. You can achieve this by conquering all the other lands or by raising the happiness of your people to a level that will allow you to do so.

The Turn

Castles & Dragons  is split into 10 turns. The turn track is at the top of the Main Board. 
Each turn represents one year in the history of Mortron. A turn is split into 8 phases.
In each phase Players perform their own actions before they can move to the next phase. The sequence of play depends on the phase.

Phase I Taxes and Resources
Phase II Upkeep
Phase III Alliances (only for 3+ players)
Phase IV Trade
Phase V Building
Phase VI Expeditions
Phase VII Battles
Phase VIII Happiness

The Game

The game will last until everybody has resolved phase VIII in turn 10 or someone has Formed a Country(in which case the game will last one more turn, unless the country was formed at turn 10).

The winner of the game is determined by calculating Victory Points. The Player with the most Victory Points will be the mightest ruler in Mortron and the winner of the game.

You will get Victory Points from the happiness of your people, buildings and missions you succeed in. If you accomplish all three missions then you will earn bonus Victory Points as will a player who manages to Form a Country.

Name: Festung Breslau 1945
Description:
- Here the victorious Soviet troops are returning from Berlin to the parade of victory in Moscow.
Suddenly, explosions and guns are heard on the way.
- Was it already shot on chevat?
- No - 6th Army is still trying to conquer Breslau ...
Dmitri Baltermanc

The board wargame "Festung Breslau 1945" allows players to see the events that took place in the besieged city between 15th February and 6th May 1945. The advantage for the game owners is that they have the opportunity to try alternative strategies for both sides.

Players take on the role of Commanders of the Red Army or fortress’ garrison. They determine the directions of assaults and dispose of available resources. Their decisions affect the outcome of the fighting. You can check whether the Russians could take the city earlier than they did historically or whether the Germans could organize the defense more effectively. Each side has its respective advantages. It is up to you whether you will use them appropriately.

Fate of "Festung Breslau" is in your hands!

A complete game „Festung Breslau 1945” contains:
• one board 48x68 cm;
• a set of 308 mounted counters (12,5x12,5mm size);
• one rule book (12 pages);
• one scenario card;
• one six sided die.

Name: The Forest Dragon
Description:
Designed by Rory, aged 9, The Forest Dragon is a fun game of testing your luck and risking everything on the turn of a card.

Dare you explore the forest? It's full of things you need, and there is treasure to be found. But beware! The forest is also full of monsters!

In The Forest Dragon you will create a fantasy world from cards, and then explore it. In a round of the game players lay out rows of cards that make up the world they are going to explore. They take it in turns to reveal one card at a time, and follow instructions on the card: Resources are collected in your backpack. Adventure items also go in the backpack, but help with the adventure. Monsters will end your expedition, sometimes taking items you've collected! You can chose to head home at any time and bank your finds. Or keep going, risking it all! Pushing your luck and knowing when to stop are key.

With amazing art from Rory and his little brother Ben, and with just a little help from their dad, games-industry veteran Jon Hodgson, The Forest Dragon is a fast and exciting game for the whole family!
